intro: Psychotria solanoides, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It is known for its alkaloid content, particularly cocaine, which has significant medicinal and illicit uses. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is also of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological research.
